      • isGenerateXmlOutput

        public boolean isGenerateXmlOutput()
        Return if XML should be rendered for test results in the generated HTML report.
        Returns:
        the generateXmlOutput true if XML should be rendered, or false otherwise

      • setGenerateXmlOutput

        public void setGenerateXmlOutput(boolean generateXmlOutput)
        Set if the XML should be rendered for test results in the generated HTML report.
        Parameters:
        generateXmlOutput - true if XML should be rendered, or false otherwise

      • setXmlToHtmlOutputDepth

        public void setXmlToHtmlOutputDepth(int xmlToHtmlOutputDepth)
        Defines the number of XML elements to output below the target element when generating XML document views in HTML based on the XPath context for a test result.
        Parameters:
        xmlToHtmlOutputDepth - a positive integer value indicating the depth to use
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the provided depth is not a positive integer value

      • getXmlToHtmlOutputChildLimit

        public int getXmlToHtmlOutputChildLimit()
        Retrieve the child depth for generated XML content in the report. The depth is the number of children to include relative to the target node before truncating.
        Returns:
        the xmlToHtmlOutputChildLimit

      • setXmlToHtmlOutputChildLimit

        public void setXmlToHtmlOutputChildLimit(int xmlToHtmlOutputChildLimit)
        Used to set a limit for the number of child elements under the result target element to render. A value of -1 will render all children, while a positive result will enforce a limit.
        Parameters:
        xmlToHtmlOutputChildLimit - the xmlToHtmlOutputChildLimit to set
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the provided limit is not -1 or a positive integer value

      • getXslTemplateExtension

        public URI getXslTemplateExtension()

      • getTestResultLimit

        public int getTestResultLimit()
        The current rendering limit for test items.
        Returns:
        the testResultLimit

      • setTestResultLimit

        public void setTestResultLimit(int testResultLimit)
        Establishes a limit for the number of test items to render in the HTML report. If positive, the items will be rendered up to this limit and any remaining items will be rendered using a single entry that provides a count of the remaining issues that were omitted.
        Parameters:
        testResultLimit - the testResultLimit to set

      • setXslTemplateExtension

        public void setXslTemplateExtension(File file)
                             throws IOException
        Used to specify an XSL template that extends the based reporting template (DEFAULT_RESULT_XSL_URL). Technically, this can be used to specify an alternate report XSL as well, since there is no requirement to actually extend the base template.
        Parameters:
        file - the template to use
        Throws:
        IOException - if the file doesn't exist or it is invalid

      • setXslTemplateExtension

        public void setXslTemplateExtension(URI uri)

      • getTargetName

        public String getTargetName()

      • setTargetName

        public void setTargetName(String targetName)

                     File outputFile)
              throws TransformerException,
                     IOException
        Throws:
        TransformerException
        IOException

      • generate

        public void generate(URL results,
                     File reportOutputFile)
              throws TransformerException,
                     IOException
        Generates an HTML report using the provided results.
        Parameters:
        results - the assessment result file location to read the results XML from
        reportOutputFile - the file location to write the report to
        Throws:
        TransformerException - if an error occurred while transforming the results.
        IOException - if an error occured while reading or writing one of the files

      • generate

        public void generate(Source resultSource,
                     Result reportResult)
              throws TransformerException,
                     IOException
        Generates an HTML report, using a Decima XML result source.
        Parameters:
        resultSource - the Decima XML result source to use
        reportResult - the result to write the report to
        Throws:
        TransformerException - if an error occurs while performing the XSL transform
        IOException - if an error occurred while reading the source or writing the result
